gurmukhi: sMkrKx hir soN khXo krIAY kvn aupwie ]sumiq mMqR dl pRbl lY rn miD phucXo Awie ]1760]
transliteration: Sankarkhan Har(i) Son Kahyodareeai Kavan Oupaae|| Soumat(i) Mantra Dal Prabal Lai Ran Madh(i) Pahouchyo Aae||1760||
translation: Balram said to Krishna, “Some step may be taken, because the minister Sumati has reached with innumerable forces in the battlefield.1760.

gurmukhi: qb boilE jdubIr FIl qjo bl hil gho ]rhIXo qum mm qIr AwgY pwCY jwih ijn ]1761]
transliteration: Tab Bolio Jadoubeer Dheel Tajo Bal Hal(i) Gado|| Raheeyo Toum Mam Teer Aagad Paachhai Jaah(i) Jin||1761||
translation: Then Krishna said, “Leave your idleness and take up your plough; be near me and do not go anywhere.”1761.

gurmukhi: rwm lIXo Dnu pwn sMBwr DsXo iqn mY mn kopu bFwXo ]bIr Anyk hny iqh Taur Gno Air isau qb ju`Du mcwXo ]
transliteration: Raam Leeyo Dhan(u) Paan Sanbhaar Dhasyo Tin Mai Man Kop(u) Badhaayo|| Beer Anek Hane Tih Thaur Ghano Ar(i) Sio Tab Juddh(u) Machadyo||
translation: Balram held up his bow and arrows and in great fury, jumped into the war-arena; he killed many warriors and waged a dreadful war with the enemy;

gurmukhi: jo koaU Awie iBrXo bl isau Aiq hI soaU Gwien ky sMg GwXo ]mUrC BUm igry Bt JUm rhy rn mY iqn swmuih DwXo ]1762]
transliteration: Jo Ko( i)  Aae Bhiryo Bal Sio At(i) Hisooo Ghaain Ke San Ghaayo|| Moondachh Bhoom Gire Bhat Jhoom Rahe Ran Mai Tin Saamuh(i) Dhaayo||1762||
translation: Whosoever came to fight with Balram, he was wounded very badly and the warrior who confronted him, he either fell down unconscious on the ground or hissed while dying.1762.

gurmukhi: kwnH kmwn lIey kr mY rn mY jb kyhir ijau BBkwry ]ko pRgitE Bt AYso blI jg DIr Dry so rn pwry ]
transliteration: Kaahn Kamaan Leee Kar Mai Ran Mai Jab Kehar(i) Jio Bhabhkdare|| Ko Pratio Bhat Aiso Balijag Dheer Ddare So Ran Pdare||
translation: When Krishna, taking up his bow and arrows, is challenging in the war like a lion, who is then so mighty not to forsake endurance and fight with him?

gurmukhi: Aaur su kaun iqhU pur mY bil sXwm isau bYr ko Bwau ibcwry ]jo hT kY koaU ju`Du krY su mrY pl mY jmlok isDwry ]1763]
transliteration: Aur Su Kaoun Tihoo Pur Mai Bal(i) Syaam Sio Bair Ko Bhaau Bichdare|| Jo Hath Kai Ko( i)  Juddh(u) Darai Su Darai Pal Mai Jamlok Sidhdare||1763||
translation: Who is there in all the three worlds who can be inimical with Balram and Krishna, but still if anyone comes persistently to fight with them, he reaches the abode of Yama in an instant.1763.

gurmukhi: jb ju`Du ko sXwm jU rwm cFy qb kaun blI rnDIr DrY ]joaU caudh lokn ko pRqpwl niRpwl su bwlk jwn lrY ]
transliteration: Jab Juddh(u) Ko Syaam Joo Raam Chadhe Tab Kaoun Balirandheer Ddarai|| Jooo Chaudah Lokan Ko Pratpaal Nripaal Su Baalak Jaan Darai||
translation: Which mighty warrior will observe endurance, seeing Balram and Krishna coming to fight? He, who is the Lord of the fourteen world, the king, considering him a child, is fighting with him;

gurmukhi: ijh nwm pRqwp qy pwp trY iqh ko rn BIqr kaun hrY ]imil Awpis mY sB lok khY irp isMD jrw ibn AweI prY ]1764]
transliteration: Jeeh Naam Prataap Te Paap Darai Tih Ko Ran Bheetar Kaoun Darai|| Mil(i) Aapas(i) Mai Sabh Lok Kahai Rip Sindh Jjaraa Bin Aaidarai||1764||
translation: He, with the glory of whose name, all the sins are destroyed, who can kill him in the war? All the people getting together are saying this that the enemy Jarasandh will die without cause.1764.
